com.forgerock.opendj.util

Class SubstringReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.forgerock.opendj.util.SubstringReader

  • public class SubstringReader
extends Object
    A sub-string reader.

      Attempts to read a substring of the specified length from the current position.

      Returns the remaining length of the available data.

      Resets the stream to the most recent mark, or to the beginning of the string if it has never been marked.

        public SubstringReader(String s)

    • Method Detail

      • getString

        public String getString()
        Returns the source string.
        Returns:
        source string.

      • mark

        public void mark()
        Marks the present position in the stream. Subsequent calls to reset() will reposition the stream to this point.

      • pos

        public int pos()
        Returns the current position of the reader.
        Returns:
        current position of the reader.

      • read

        public char read()
        Attempts to read a character from the current position. The caller must ensure that the source string has the data available from the current position.
        Returns:
        The character at the current position.
        Throws:
        StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - If there is no more data available to read.

      • read

        public String read(int length)
        Attempts to read a substring of the specified length from the current position. The caller must ensure that the requested length is within the bounds i.e. the requested length from the current position should not exceed the length of the source string.
        Parameters:
        length - The number of characters to read.
        Returns:
        The substring.
        Throws:
        StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the length exceeds the allowed length.

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Returns the remaining length of the available data.
        Returns:
        remaining length.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the stream to the most recent mark, or to the beginning of the string if it has never been marked.

      • skipWhitespaces

        public int skipWhitespaces()
        Skips the whitespace characters and advances the reader to the next non whitespace character.
        Returns:
        number of whitespace characters skipped.

      • skipDelims

        public int skipDelims()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
